results.title: What is an amphibian?
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
This film illustrates the body structure and life process of amphibians and shows their adaptation to life in water and on land. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: What is a word processor? or Tale of two sisters
results.creator_credit: Robert Reid, Video Arts, IBM (UK) and Peter Robinson
results.brief_description: A John Cleese training film which explains the principles and illustrates the nature of word processing. Shows all the aspects of office work which the processor can make quicker or easier, and provides a framework of understanding which dispels the mystery and threat surrounding this technology. Features John Cleese, Alison Steadman, Kay Stonham and Carol Hawkins. Photography by Arthur Wooster, sound by Bruce White, edited by Colin Sherman, narrated by Judi Dench, written by David Nobbs.
results.title_for_label: What is a word processor? or Tale of two sisters
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Reid, Video Arts, IBM (UK) and Peter Robinson

results.title: What is a reptile?
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
Describes four orders of reptiles and discusses their physical characteristics, reproductive processes and their evolutionary development. Discusses reasons for the successful evolution and survival of the reptile. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: What is a map?
results.brief_description: A small girl, writing to her friend, attempts to explain what her bedroom looks like. By use of animation and photographic techniques, the concept of maps is introduced and explained, first in terms of the living room plan and then in terms of a map of the neighbourhood.

results.title: What is a mammal?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
Demonstrates the basic structural and behavioural characteristics of mammals and describes their successful adaptation to a wide variety of ecological niches. Compares reptilian and mammalian characteristics, such as reactions to temperature, reproduction; sense organs and skull structure. Discusses the evolution of mammals, illustrates their variety and shows their distribution. Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: What is a limit? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edward Goldwyn, BBC-TV and David Nelson
results.brief_description: Analysis is that branch of mathematics which gives precision to vague terms like ‘infinitely large’ and ‘infinitesimally small’ and is founded on the concept of a limit. In this program, ideas behind a limit are examined and a formal definition to the limit of a sequence is reached.

In this program, ideas behind a limit are examined and a formal definition to the limit of a sequence is reached.

results.title: What is a Jew to you?
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubetzki, Aviva Ziegler and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Documentary film maker Aviva Ziegler turns the camera on herself in this personal exploration of what being Jewish means to her and why she calls herself a Jew despite not maintaining a Jewish lifestyle. She speaks with family and friends about growing up in Sydney, commenting on religious practices from the past, pondering why her brother has maintained his Jewish heritage and Aviva has gravitated towards other groups in society. Aviva reaches the conclusion that the effects of the Holocaust have made her feel Jewish, regardless of whether she is living within the tradition or not.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Rubetzki, Aviva Ziegler and Film Australia

results.title: What is a fish
results.creator_credit: Michael Birch and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
Illustrates the major types of fish showing the anatomy of a typical fish, behaviour patterns such as commensalism, spawning, predation and territoriality.

results.title: What is a firefighter?
results.creator_credit: David Ferris, Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Trevor Lunn introduces Brion Jones, Station Officer, M.F.B. who outlines the training and different tasks performed by fireman including rescuing people from fires, extinguishing fires, preventing the spread and property damage caused by fires, road rescue, assisting with chemical incidents, gas leaks and unusual rescues from cliffs, trenches and drains.

results.title: What is a curriculum day?
results.creator_credit: Lily Steiner, TV Ed Productions and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: A primary and postprimary teacher and parent/school councillor outline what is involved in a curriculum day. They discuss the benefits for both parents and teachers in evaluating school programs and ideas to facilitate the development of working relationships between both parties.
